title: France prepares for unpredictable municipal elections, one year before presidential vote
subhead: Local officials fear the national political crisis will have a ripple effect on the upcoming municipal elections in March. Three-way and four-way runoffs are expected to be widespread, paving the way for political realignments just months before the crucial 2027 presidential contest.

title: Zelensky blasts EU at Davos, claims US security guarantees for Ukraine are ready
France's far-right RN toughens stance on Trump to avoid 'trap' ahead of 2027 presidential election
Europe relieved but 'vigilant' as Trump eases pressure on Greenland
subhead: European Union leaders met for an emergency summit on the transatlantic relationship on Thursday, following US President Donald Trump's recent push to acquire Greenland. Some leaders welcomed Trump's announcement of a deal with NATO chief Mark Rutte for a permanent deployment of the alliance to the Arctic island, though details were scant.

title: Two reports accuse Israel of deliberately destroying Gaza's reproductive health system
subhead: The number of births in Gaza fell by 41% in the first six months of 2025 compared to the same period in 2022, according to the work of two NGOs, Physicians for Human Rights and Physicians for Human Rights Israel.

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear aviator sunglasses (when you're Emmanuel Macron)?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: Dior and Vuitton: The question of innovation at Paris men's fashion week
subhead: For the fall-winter 2026-2027 menswear collections, presented in Paris through January 25, Pharrell Williams designed an everyday wardrobe at Vuitton, while Jonathan Anderson offered a new vision for Dior menswear.

'As it ceases to inspire, the US is losing part of itself'
subhead: Donald Trump's second term has turned the United States into a threat to which the rest of the world has no choice but to adapt. Yet, over the past eight decades, habits and practices have taken root that will be used to counter this new imperialism, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Marine Duc, geographer: 'In Greenland, the memory of colonial violence remains strong'
subhead: Donald Trump's ambitions for the Arctic island have affected Danish policies toward the Inuit population and influenced the expression of Greenlandic nationalism, the academic explained in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Maya Kandel, historian: 'The more Trump uses force, the more confident he becomes'
subhead: Elected on an isolationist promise, the American president has multiplied foreign interventions. This policy risks weakening his MAGA base, the researcher says in an interview with Le Monde.

title: A brief respite in the transatlantic crisis
'French military involvement in Greenland is not for show'
